result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan J. Imm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.  Not in ingest any impairing substances not specifically prescribed by a treating physician.  No contact with the victim unless authorized by the Supervising Agent.  Defendant's residence address would not be considered a violation of the no contact provision.

Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  The assessment is to be completed within 30 days of the sentencing date.  Defendant to complete an in-patient program if found appropriate by the assessment and if there is insurance coverage available for that program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: In WC Jail on 60 day contempt order for FTP
RE: Work Release and Good Time Credit

3:47 pm case called. Defendant Jordan J. Imm in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions parties regarding motion to revoke Huber/Good Time Credit. Statement by DA Blader regarding motion. Personal appearance and waiver discussed with the defendant. Statement by . Court orders that there has been a material violation of Work Release privileges and that violation relates to introducing contraband into the jail setting. Court revokes Work Release for duration of the sentence Court will cancel any good time credit earned between Dec. 22, 2014 and March 5, 2015 which equals 18 days credit.
to Revoke Work Release Privileges and/or Forfeiture of Good Time Credit
from Agent Parker - DE has been revoked on an imposed and stayed sentence

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan J. Imm

Prior: 148 Maple Street, Redgranite, WI 54970

Case Called @ 8:37 AM: Defendant Jordan J. Imm in court with attorney Matthew L Goldin.   Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Recommendation recited by the State on resolution.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Repeater component dismissed.  Ct 2 DRI.  Victim present in Court and DA makes statement on his behalf.  Argument by Atty Goldin.  Statement by Def:  Yes apologizes to the Court and victim.  The Court:  Will follow agreement - 7 mos WCJ - I/S (Huber Privileges, GT and 31 days TS credit) - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  Ab Sobriety; Complete AODA within 30 days of Sentencing; Complete an In-Patient Program if found appropriate by the assessment and if there is insurance coverage for that program available; Bar Prohibition; not to ingest any impairing substances not specifically prescribed by treating physician; RX prohibition; No contact w/victim unless authorized by supervising agent - residence address would not be considered a violation of this order; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called @ 3:14 p.m. Defendant Jordan J. Imm in court with attorney Matthew L Goldin.  Defendant Jordan J. Imm in custody. Attorney Goldin appears telephonically.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Atty Golding requests a preliminary hearing. Motion by Atty Goldin to amend bond to $200 Cash Bond. The court declines to amend the bond in any way. Preliminary Hearing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
and Order for Modification of Bond
Initial appearance on June 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Case called @ 1:11 p.m. Defendant Jordan J. Imm in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1200 Cash Bond. Atty Roberts-Turner requesting signature bond or lower cash bond. Court orders $ Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
